Declined!

Interesting move forcing black to defend.
Black should not play Nxe5 or else:
6. Qxe5+ Qe7
7. Qxe4 Qxe4
8. Nxe4
and white has a decisive advantage
This move gives white a pawn advantage if black plays Kxf7
This move gives white a pawn advantage if black plays Kxf7
This move gives white a pawn advantage if black plays Kxf7
This move gives white a pawn advantage if black plays Kxf7

Better was Nxf2! which leads to a very unusual game:
7 ...Nxf2!
8. Nxh8 Nxh1
9. Nb5 Nb4
10. Nxc7+ Kd8
11. Nxa8 Nxc2+
12. Kd1 Nxa1
13. Nf7+ Ke7
14. Ng5 Nf2+
15. Ke1 Ng4
16. Bd3
etc
It makes sense to develop the bishop first before capturing the knight otherwise black may play d5.
